item.description:
On Mon, Dec. 12, the Coolidge Corner Theatre's Science on Screen series is showing Terry Gilliam's sci-fi flick "Twelve Monkeys," about a convict (Bruce Willis) sent back in time to investigate the origins of a virus that wiped out nearly all of the earth's population decades earlier. Guest speaker is the awesome science writer Carl Zimmer (whose books include A Planet of Viruses), who will talk about virus outbreaks before the film. Is the future history? Program starts at 7pm. More at http://www.coolidge.org/science.

Click on the blue "7 pm" link to buy a ticket online. http://www.coolidge.org/programs/science-on....

Let's meet beforehand at the Panera, at 6:30. Panera is across the street from the theater at 299 Harvard Ave. We can walk over together.
item.how_to_find_us: Let's meet at 6:30 (30 minutes beforehand) at Panera across from the theater.
item.name: "Twelve Monkeys" on 12/12 (Coolidge Corner)
